she trapped him in the bathroom? She is telling different stories not even the same one. She says she cannot remember what she just heard on the tape. She is an actress used to memorizing lines for films. That should not be hard not remember what she just heard herself say it on the phone and what she says two minutes ago on the stand in her testimony.   The tapes I have heard and the video I saw her play of JD show her acting like a vindictive person. I would say he was tired of her fighting over things . They could have discussed it and said how she was not happy because he visited his neighbor.  After awhile you get to the point it is better not to be in the vicinity of the abuser. comment: I am a female survivor of domestic violence.  When I hear about all the incidents of Amber actually hitting, punching, throwing things at Johnny and his security staff never filed police reports it makes me mad.  If his staff hadn't gotten on the record for all the incidents they witnessed, this case would have stopped four years ago.  Moreover, once an abuser is allowed to escape accountability for this type of abuse, they position themselves as the victim to take the actual victim for whatever they can get out of them --even if all that is is using the legal system to continue to abuse the victim or get a better divorce settlement, such as in Johnny's case.  Shame on Johnny's security staff for not filing police reports when they witnessed Amber punching, hitting, and lobbing objects at Johnny.  They are almost as responsible for this charade as Amber and her friends.  If they had filed police reports, Amber probably would have left the relationship rather than be held accountable for her abuse.  No man or woman should be abused by an intimate partner.  Anyone who witnesses abuse needs to file a police report.  Abusers abuse because they get away with it.  As a society, as individuals, we need to stand up against abuse whether the abuser is male or female.

author: Christina Mussared

comment: Wondering why they haven't asked her how she thought her only exit from the altercation was through the bathroom door that Johnny was hiding in. Strange layout for a home. She is such an idiot. I was in an abusive relationship with a narcissist which is partly what created my curiosity about this case- she is a rich and famous person but i hear my poor male ex in all of her ramblings from her recorded discussions with JD and i am still in awe that the two are exactly the same person. The soulless have nothing creative or unique about them, theyre like bots. When i heard johnny say (maybe it was a text) "i loved you and you never existed" my heart broke for him. That is such a striking detail that only true victims of a narcissist can understand with its full weight... these people are shape shifters in so many ways--body snatchers--imposters. They are not capable of changing. At one point toward the end of my relationship with my ex, i got so sick of the changing stories i just told him, "i am not playing this game, im not buying it. Im the only one that is here. You and i both know you are lying, can we agree to skip this part because theres no one else here to trick, theres no one else, im not playing this game and you know very well that we both know you are lying" (something along these lines) and i can still see his horrible confusion as he didnt know how to talk his way out of a lie that i had physical proof of (which was a phone record given to me from his mom full of calls and texts to different women and a drug dealer). I saw a photo of him online only a couple days after and his clothes were radically different and looked to match the style of his new friends. I found out about his drugs and cheating thanks to his mom knowing what he was and trying to help me. He grabbed my face to tell me through tears that he would never lie to me again while i was getting into my car to head to school and the phone records were emailed to me later that day. He called his dealer 4 minutes after i left the driveway. After 15 years of knowing him, and 3 years living together- i didnt know his real job or even his real memories or activities. When i told his best friend that i had proof he was sleeping with his pregnant girlfriend, we shared stories and so much truth was discovered, including that he used his friends stories and memories as his own. These people need to be avoided at all costs. They relish in your frustration as they break down all the trust in your own senses. Screw em.
author: Little Yeti

comment: I grew up keeping up with Johnny Depp and his movies, for a while I had to stop, so I had no idea he was going through this... But now that I know I feel so so sad for Johnny and I want to say that he is my hero... A few years back I sent him a letter with the help of my school telling him how his movies got me through dark times and he was amazing enough to send me an autographed picture of himself with All the best wishes -JD on it, it is still hung on my wall to this day. I wish I had some way to send another letter to him and say something to him about this because I watched the same type of thing happen to my mom and then me and my siblings experienced it as well... I would give everything I own for him to see this and know that he has many many people still willing to fight for him and speak up against people like that. If there is anything I can do to reach out to him and say that even without all the video evidence and everything, if Johnny had ever been able to say what was happening, I as well as many others, would still believe him and do whatever we could to support him and show him he is not alone. This kind of thing makes me mad because he is the most amazing man this world has to offer in my eyes, I've seen and heard of how he goes to hospitals in full Jack sparrow costume for sick kids to make their day, and how he talks to his fans when meeting him, even when they go into hysterics, he is so kind and friendly with them to make their day just because that's who he is. He would never abuse someone the way she says he did, and she should have been in prison long before she could get this far.

comment: @incredibly average You said in your video someone explain to me if she actually believes she can make people believe the exact opposite of what happened. As a narcissistic abuse survivor myself and having witnessed other Narcissist and victim pairs closely, I can assure you they GENUINELY BELIEVE THEY CAN CONVINCE OTHER PEOPLE, AND THEIR STRONG BELIEF DOES TRULY RUB ON OTHER PEOPLE AND THEY START BELIEVING IT AS WELL... Belief catches on, that's human psychology at work. However THEY DONT THEMSELVES BELIEVE THEIR OWN LIES, THEY 100 PRECENT REMEMBER EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED, HENCE THE CONTRADICTING BODY LANGUAGE AND CONSTANTLY TRYING TO ADJUST THE STORY.... Narcissists are very different from con men, if it was a con woman she would have prepared and rehersed for these questions over and over again, they are very obvious questions that she ofcourse was expecting, but she still didn't get her story straight, she as a narcissist genuinely believed that she doesn't need to get her story straight because she will be able to convince everyone anyway. This over confidence often leads to a narcissist's demise. I would not even be here discussing this topic right now if I was not personally a DA survivor and was extremely offended by the fact that a narcissist was charging 30,000 dollars to give speeches against domestic violence. We have it bad enough already that these narcissist reach support groups and make a fool out of us there as well. This has to stop. Stealing other victims story just ads insult to the injury, something I can relate to as well.

comment:
Definitely not a defence for AH, but a lot of people who either are in the legal field or work closely with it, pointed out her eating and not giving straight forward answers was probably coached by her lawyers. You can‚Äôt broadly interpret a yes or a no, so instead give long elaborate answers that could be taken in different lights without necessarily lying (in her case, she‚Äôs still lying but it‚Äôs how she justifies and tries to avoid stating that she is). Eating also is suggested to give them time to form a broad, vague response, and to give the lawyer to interject 3 million times. Definitely still comes off as rude and disinterested, which I think she is, but also was likely coached. 

What I think is interesting to note, that for a ‚Äúdomestic violence victim,‚Äù professional behavioural analysts pointed out that when all the lawyers are arguing and getting heated, AH seems to calm and look like she‚Äôs enjoying the chaos. A DV victim would be unnerved by it because chaos, and anger could easily translate into abuse, but her body language relaxes and leans into it, like this is her normal, this is what she understands, this is what she thrives off of.

comment:
THEORY:
The eating provides a means of "coded language", prearranged between Amber & her lawyer.
She breaks off a piece out of the wrapper as one signal.
She takes a bigger piece and breaks it in two, putting one piece back into the package--that's another signal.
Putting her hand to her mouth while chewing--that signal means another thing.
Dusting off her hands--signal... wiping the banister with her palm--yet another signal, that has a meaning.
~Steven of Montreal

[Apologize in advance for length, but all feels right to be said.]
So here's an actress, (which should never be forgotten - particularly on the stand, as facial expressions are so very important - even vital in most roles, and can literally make or break your success as an actor) - and yet she's unconvincing in both reality and her 'so-called-profession'!  
Too funny!
I had this in 1995 - having to quickly hide and shut 'our' bedroom door, as I heard my then wife bashing not 1 but 2 holes into the other side of the door face! 
That was gonna be either my face or my back! 
She was holding a round screw bit driver I had left out! 
(My wife was not short nor weak!)  
THEN - I hear her calling the police on - yup - you guessed it - me! NOT her! The phone was just a few feet from that door I was now hiding behind like a giant pussy. (I was 6' 2", 232 lbs in construction full time back then).
So 1 cop questioned her outside, 1 in with me. 

I made sure I was calm and relaxed, expecting their arrival. 
I said, "Well Officer, here's what happened, (as described above). 
So the way I see it, I had 2 choices:
1. Grab her arms or even smack her to try and settle her down, which I just don't do! Never have!  And then you 2 cops are hauling me away in handcuffs in front of all my neighbors AND also a co-worker right across the street 
OR
2. Run and hide behind my own bedroom door like a p.hu.cki.n pussy!!  
Now just how do suppose either one of those makes me feel, Officer??"

He said he thought I made the right decision by removing myself and 'de-escalating the situation', as they say. He agreed that they would have hauled me away, otherwise. They didn't - because I was the calm one. 
Notice how Johnny is always the calm one, also.

And despite the cops finally telling me that she actually told the outside cop that she called them because she wasn't sure what she might do to me, guess who's name got trashed, dragged though the mud and forever tarnished in not 1 but BOTH families - with prejudice to this day!

Yup - you guessed it again!! 
Me!

The file stayed with the police as a 'domestic dispute call' until I finally called and had it cleared after inactivity some 23 years later. 
But the file was in MY NAME - not hers! And against me - not her! - even with all I just typed above, and never got updated nor corrected in my favor!!! 

These lessons I learn the hard way I NEVER forget!!!

So I have zero simpping for this c.h.i.c.k. or any other like her - who are not only the aggressors, but try to turn it around and play the victim!
Been there, done that - more than once!!!

Now - what's that you say there? 
M.G.T.O.W.??   What the h. e. !. l. is that??
Hmmm...let's check it out! 
Let's see what THAT'S all about in full detail ~ BEFORE I ever date again!!!


Hmmm...Veddy  Inta  Res  Tink - this M .G .T . O.W. !!  I like it!!

comment: This happened to me, the parallels are jaw-dropping (right down to locking myself in the bathroom while she shoved and pounded on the door (for me resulting in a severed tendon in my right hand from a broken glass). But the worst part about being abused by someone like this is how it happens so insidiously, interspersed with triggering behaviour and lovembombing and twists your head in knots. It took me a long time to even realise I WAS being abused until when I did, I barely escaped with life and health, being pursued by spitting venom and horrific threats the whole way and for months afterwards. He was choking me and I HAD had it. My son came out of his room. And  he's holding me up against the wall. So my hand was over his shoulder. And I'm gasping for air. Our Son was 17yrs.old and he was going to try to protect me. I knew he would hurt my son really bad. He weighed 300+ pounds. So with my pointer finger I signal  for him please go back to his room. When he started I always said kids in your room's.When my son was back in. I was passing out. So he eased up I had a 2ft decorative fork on the wall behind me. So I turn my arm around and as he let go I broke the tines of it over his elbow. He said in tears.When I get off the floor I'm f**king kill you. comment:
I hate the projection bullshit SO MUCH. In my experience with it, there were frequent patterns of shitty, unmindful behavior with my partner, & every time these things happened I would try to have a conversation about why that's not cool & is hurtful. But it would never work, it would always turn into a big blow out because she'd take everything as a personal attack. Certain words would set her off & she'd just ignore my point & go off about how I'm shitting on her like everybody else does. & most any time some big blow out would happen, she would instantly accuse me of doing what she does in her never changing patterns. If you said it first, it's only true when you say it & I'm just copying you when I tell you you do that to me, right?
If she actually did acknowledge what I was saying to her, she'd tell me I was lying, I was delusional, I was too sensitive, she was stressed (therefore it's fine & I should deal with it?), or I in some sense drove her to this behavior.
There were things I hated that she did regarding me that I never talked about (I had to come up with the perfect way to say things so it wouldn't be taken as a personal attack rather than me opening up about something that's really bringing me down, so there were lots of things I never ended up speaking up on), & I would be accused of them whenever she was upset at me, even when even hypothetically it didn't make sense in the current situation. There was a huge lack of self-awareness with this one. Only when feeling wayyy down, & blaming herself for everything she did & didn't do, did she every recognize her behavior with me & apologize for the fucked up, unfair ways she treated me in. But any other time? Accountability?: 0. Victim?: Always, her against the world for life, I'm her enemy even though I gave her nothing but kindness & support. Empathy for me?: 0
If someone does that shit to you, just leave. They're not going to even try to change unless they realize what they're doing, but you need self-awareness to do that, which projection of this kind usually doesn't come with.

author: Fikri Fuad

comment:
You do good work dude. I‚Äôve followed it from the start and appreciate it greatly. It is important.

With that said, you do need to be mindful of your analysis of body language. Things like fiddling, eye contact, eye fluttering etc are a sign of anxiety not of lying. They are a staple in any interrogation, deposition, victim statement etc etc. These types of analyses have lost countless victims their cases even in instances of obvious evidence.

Now I know that is not the case with Heard vs. Depp. And that her body language is being interpreted WITHIN the context of demonstrable lies. But we do need to make sure that we aren‚Äôt taking conclusions further than what the evidence shows. If she wasn‚Äôt lying (which we know she was), we should still expect these exact same mannerisms.

comment: As a survivor of horrific domestic violence,  I can tell you that if someone is genuinely abused, they want to get out of there, away from the abuser, at any cost.  I finally was able to leave when my husband went out of town for a job interview.  I quickly threw my clothes and a few other personal possessions in my car (as well as my beloved dog, who he also abused and is still with me today) and got the hell out.  I later told the divorce attorney that I didn't want anything from my ex-husband, I was just glad to be away from him.  He later told me that this was how he knew I was really abused.  He said women who claim they've been "abused" but then go on to ask for tons of money, the car, valuables, etc... are often times just using the domestic violence as a way to get attention and to win the case.  Amber asked for tons of money, their Range Rover, etc...  I find her deposition sickening to watch and an insult to people, like me, who have truly lived through the terror of domestic abuse.  I hope she is sentenced to the maximum prison time and is made to volunteer at women's domestic violence shelters

comment:
I just want to say I love your videos and have watched all of them. I like that they didn't take a break while she was eating ( I'm sure if needed they would break for lunch or dinner, depending on the time. She is just having a snack.)  it shows how flippant she is about everything. Your videos are the best ones out there and I appreciate you making them. You always back up everything with evidence and you are very professional about it all. I subscribed to your channel because I heard another YouTube channel talking about how if you want the best, most through content it was on your page and while you have a lot of views you don't have a lot of subscribers. I think that is because everyone is so enthralled by your videos. I believe you should have a ton of subscribers.

 I am so happy the truth is finally out. I feel awful for Johnny Depp. Even after everything she did to him he still sat on those audios. In one of said audios he pretty much begs Amber to keep this private. To not go to court. He knew what it would do to her and her career. Even then he was still trying to protect her. The absolute gull she has going on t.v and saying she wants to be an advocate for other DV victims. It's discusting and I truly believe she is a narcissist. I always liked Johnny Depp and I was shocked when this first hit the news, that he was physically and emotionally abusing AH. My first thought was no way but she seemed to have some evidence. I still didn't truly believe her, something was off. Johnny Depp is a good man. Everyone he's ever worked with adores him. A lot of his ex's are coming to his defense. Normally people jump at the chance to talk crap about their ex's. As you can tell I am very passionate about this. Yes, I love Johnny Depp but it goes so much further than that. It's about the truth and justice and how people should never rush to their own judement. Thank you again for making these videos! Please keep them coming!

comment:
Wow. This is so educational. The narcissist tip at the start helped considerably. She's incapable of taking responsibility. 
Let's say for instance your father tickled you inappropriately, as a child. And you enjoyed it.
And ultimately discovered sex. And this continued until you discovered the gravity of the situation and that it was wrong.
Are you responsibile for that? No. But in your own head, because you enjoyed it, you feel responsible. 
But logically you're not at fault. To deal with this, you might learn to not take responsibility for things that could potentially shame you. 
And bring those feelings back. Those feelings, as you age, go from embarrassment to anger to rage. Your rage becomes a shield.
She's literally screaming "i did not enjoy that sex". But her brain's telling her she did. Narcissists remain conflicted. And so dont share the same range of emotions we do. 
Particularly empathy

Having said that, not all narcissists are victims.

author: Lorraine Skinner

comment: Thank you for putting these videos out here. I know this situation SO well. I was the domestic partner to my exgf whom I lived with and she has been diagnosed on the spectrum between bipolar and borderline. She was nice a lot of the time but would have consistently extreme emotional reactions to small problems. Her doctors classified it as emotional dis-regulation. It was always (usually) behind closed doors away from the public because vanity and ego was extremely important to her and she never wanted people to see what she was actually like at her worst. What people don't understand is this is a serious mental illness... when someone gets into a fit of rage they cannot think rationally, you cannot 'talk' to them, they scream, do what's called 'pressured speech,' and they are incapable of stopping or listening. For lack of a better description it is like a 3 year old temper tantrum in an adult body with an adult ability to manipulate another person. It is an extremely toxic state that you CANNOT do ANYTHING but leave the room or remain and risk escalating the situation to the point that they have riled you up to their same level of anger and torment. It is a living hell and it is domestic abuse. In times of serenity she would explain that all she wants is a hug and to feel wanted and accepted and I would try and explain that it's like a steam powered machine that has overheated and you're asking that in order to turn it off you want me to hug red hot metal with my  bare hands. It's an impossible situation. I was hit multiple times and never hit back. One time and one time only I had to grab her shoulders and push her away from me and I felt so awful and guilty to for doing even that. I 100% understand why JD said to her that when things get to a bad level, he HAS to walk away. No man wants to be provoked to use their strength against a someone they love. No good man, anyway. JD must have been in a living hell. Don't get me wrong, I think that my ex as well as AH are in their own form of mental hell, horrible anguish, when they are in that state but they have to realize that THEY are the ones that are responsible for their own actions/words and they bring innocent people into their terrible hell. THANK GOD the truth is finally coming out. Thank you for exposing it. I know it takes two to tango but take it from me that when a woman has this mental problem, they do and say things that would be considered EVIL by most standards. Peace and respect to all domestic abuse victims that have been noble and patient within their abuse, men and women.
author: B Marchant

comment:
Absolutely eyeopening watching this as a 3rd party perspective. Your spot on on the eye roll's the twitching, the behavior (and the thought bubbles)  but you missed 2 details. The first being her eating; consuming sustenance. If you have to tell a personal, traumatic event/story that happened to you, the last thing your body wants, is food ?? So why/how the f*ck is she eating ? And this you saw, to have time to think about her b*llsh*t story. Genius as evil goes, but evil none the less. And her turning her head sideways when she is suppose to "feel" empathy. She does this when listening to question asked to her (thank god the lawyer interrupts so she cant answer directly and honestly) genius ... but vile ... I think after watching this and from my own personal experience I can summarize this into a story witch raps it all together in a nice bow.


A penguin, lets call her Amber. Wakes up every day to catch fish. To feed her, being single only her live matters. Only she need to watch out for the big, scary polar beer that is outside her hut everyday. Lets call the beer Johnny. Johnny has every intention of eating her, the second he gets the change. He is a risk each time she goes out, and comes back to her hut. The contains fear she has to live in, every day is taking up so much of her energy. That it compromises her ability to catch fish. And there for to feed herself. And she matters, so she has to do something. So she comes up with a trick to get rid of the polar beer once and for all. She invites him into her hut with kindness and false promises, and when he's not looking and least expects it. She will stab him in the face with one of the sharp icicles in her hut. And she did, Johnny run away, bleeding into the forest and the penguin was free and lived happily ever after...

But that not the end. Johnny is a big beer, yes. But he's not a polar beer. He's a panda. A big round, fluffie, clumsy, lazy, sweet (VEGETARIAN) panda. The penguin is his neighbor and he was trying to be nice, and slowly fell for her beauty and sweet voice. But now, the other animals, won't talk to Johnny anymore. Or have anything to do with him. His hearth is broken, also he now has two black eye's from the incident. But what hurt the most, is he lost his neighbor, the penguin that he loved.
author: Niels Buirma

comment:
Lawyer What's-Her-Face was asking Heard to make a _legal_ determination, because "domestic violence" must be a _legal_ term in that state, or is sufficiently equivalent, and Heard's _legal determination_ is irrelevant in a deposition, probably because she's not an appellate judge. Because the deposition will be used as evidence in court, and because as a witness she's not qualified to make legal determinations, her lawyer is getting on the record the fact that Lawyer What's-Her-Face is asking inadmissible questions and Heard's answers are therefore inadmissible as well. 
     At least, that's my reading of it.

comment: 3 years ago I was tangled up in an abusive relationship with a narcissist. When I would voice any issue with his behavior no matter how small he would always bring up that I was to sensitive and bring up my recent concerns that I was going through menopause. For the previous year, this was always his go to explanation as to why we were having an issue. I will never forget one of our last face to face discussions where I said to him ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt just blame my menopause for all my feelings‚Äù he looked me straight in the eye without any hesitation and said, ‚Äú menopause?...This is the first time I have ever heard you were going through menopause‚Äù.  I was so stunned and he just sat there looking at me like he was truly baffled and had no idea what I was referring too.  Projection and gaslighting is a very real and a powerful tool narcissists use to deflect and make you feel crazy.  Amber‚Äôs monologue is a massive trigger for me and I can see her using all these tactics to disable her victim. It‚Äôs sickening . My heart goes out to Johnny. I know what he was going through first hand. :(

comment:
Why do this body language bs, it's become so popular these recent years, suddenly everyone's a "expert" and the best of them have an accuracy of 10-15 %. We know she's lying because of her character, BS story and the evidence. The body language crap is not needed. Simply for one reason, if you are looking for body language and ordinary language to prove her innocence you can just as easily do that. 

As in she's obviously emotional when talking about the incident with her sister, the forhead wrinkles is proof of real emotion, she's leaning forward which fits her passionate nature in where she adresses problems head on. She's not crossing her arms defensivly, nor is she creating a barrier between her and the one asking questions, She's not using language as that man, or him when refering to Johnny which means that she's not trying to distance herself from the incident.
And she's not mentioning her sister by name, proving her natural tendency to defend her.

It's all just BS anyone can do, and the worst part of it is that the same thing that can "prove" someones innocent can just as easily be "proving" someones guilt. As eye contact and emotional states etc.

comment:
If you willingly continue to engage with a narcissist, you are just as guilty as they are. 
Everybody at this point knows (or should know) about narcississtic abuse and the concept of going "no contact." These things have been widely publicized!  There are a hundred thousand books, articles, and Youtube channels on the subject of going "no contact" with an abusive person.
If you don't like someone's abuse, you go "no contact." 
However, if you like their abuse, you stay in contact with them, but you don't get to ask for endless amounts of sympathy and support as you complain about the abuse or point the finger at the abuser, because my question to you will be: "Did you go "no contact?" Johnny Depp knew she was batshit crazy and he continued to engage, he liked it. He could have went "no contact," filed for divorce, and holed himself up in one of his dozens of homes he owns. But he chose to engage in the dysfunction with Amber under the same roof. He is no better than she is.

author: Stephanie Stogner

comment:
I didn't punch you, I hit you..  Um.. huh? Then, says well, I don't know the motion my hand did, but I didn't punch you.. Um.. if you don't know the motion then how do you know?? Also, how do you not recall what you've done to someone? Is that because you do it so frequently you can't recall each instance, or because you can't control yourself and so in a rage haze can't recall your behavior? I mean, either way you need serious mental health intervention. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è These are things I've heard abusers say btw... not word for word, but basically the same. The audio between them sounds so typical. If you had read this dialogue with a man reading amber's part and a woman reading Johnny's the media would have been like why isn't (Amber) locked up already? 

The fact is the system fails domestic violence sufferers of all sexes and identity groupings, in various ways. To make every case a stereotype is ridiculous. Why would one want to ignore abuse on a particular sex to boost the message for abuse on another? Unless one isn't in it for the issue, but the publicity and "social credit." Abuse is abuse. And the inconvenience to the simple black and white story some like to spin is that isn't just women who are victims. Many male victims face the same issues including reasons for not reporting and not being believed, including the ideas about manliness, that they could even be abused, that they're cowards, that they're lying, etc. The point is anyone can be an abuser and anyone can be abused. Is it mostly women? Maybe. But because of underreporting, I can't say that with certainty. But in the end is this a competition on whi gets abused more? I'd simply like to end all abuse. Stop abuse, period. 

But if you jump to conclusions and allow stereotypes and biases to get in the way, this is what happens. You support a liar, and feed a monster.. There are people who lie for example about having cancer or something similar.. this is the same type of person. They see what they can use and use it. That movement was big and you get publicized and called a hero for surviving.. Only issue is were you actually. There are violent women and abusive women. There are liars and narcissists. Sex and gender do not determine who does what. To put abuse in all forms to bed, people have to open their eyes to abuse by anyone. 

(Also, I am super tired of any differing opinions in a conversation being called an attack. That word is super overused as is the idea of triggers and ptsd. Just mentioning it as I've seen it used improperly and I am sure I heard mention being attacked with words in a different video.. and it was not an attack at all. Grow up.) 

Just as someone who has been in and out of group therapies since I was a small child I can recognize the manipulator immediately and the abuser and the abused. This situation has an extra added level of disgusting in that she flipped it (as abusers often do) to being his fault and he's the abuser and then used it to "fight" for women. Disgusting.
author: Stephanie Stogner

comment:
It's very sad and not so uncommon as many think, which makes it even a even more sad case. To go on public with this is even worse, it's not only the hitting but also the verbal violence and belittling, making it harder for the victim to go out with it. Besides the twisted feeling, you still love him/her. 


There are some weird things happening on with this vid, but I let that rest with the idea that's Murica, while the rest of the world would do it completely else. Sweets on the table are placed for a reason and she fell for it , hard. I do not like your thought clouds, distracting and showing your opinion. And you know what you can do with your opinion... But that aside. The prosecutor is trying to derail her at first glance which is coming to an ambush, screaming. She replies "No" to the question, which the pros. replies with" The question? Then she laughs and I am with her on that one. Is the pros. serious? Is she trying to derail me at every corner, this going to be easy. But Miss. Heard isn't that smart is seems, she is going to derail herself a few times during the vid, makes a lot of projections. But you can see clearly she wants to talk this out with Mr. Depp and doesn't see how far she has gone. It's sad. When she clearly lying, she looks straight at the pros. and clenches her jaw, it can be tense, it can be the candy. But the fun fact of this all, she talks too much, to detailed, she has thought the situation over and over and over, till it all polished. And still you fuck it up?


This is personal for Mr.Depp and Miss Heard, we do not have a fuck to say about it, besides it being lower then shit to capitalize on their misery. I wish them the best of luck and for the others that in such situation, try to talk with someone you trust, this has to stop.

comment: Can people please look carefully at Pat Patrix's (see his early April, 2020 comment below)??  (THANK YOU PAT PATRIX!!!)?  I mean the points made by the video and everyone are good/great points, but in court, it's hard evidence that matters the end (at least in theory!).   Amber says that she is trying to "escape" from Johnny's attacks.  As Pat observed: How is  'trying to escape from Depp" involve her "escaping" to the bathroom where Depp was already inside?  Additionally, note that her toes were caught under the door as Depp pushed the door back (he admits to that).  But ALL bathroom doors open to the inside of the bathroom.  If she's trying to "escape" from Johnny, what were her feet doing INSIDE the bathroom (where she knew beforehand that Johnny was inside of)?  If she's trying to escape, WHY were her toes pointed towards the door?  How was there an OUTWARD force on the door (door closing direction) that jammed her toes (toes that were both INSIDE the bathroom and pointed TOWARDS the inside of the bathroom)?  The only possible explanation for her is that she was trying to pull the door shut order to lock Johnny in the bathroom, and in the tug of war, Johnny let go.  BUT NOTHING in her story supports (or even hints) at that scenario.  Now from court evidence to my own opinion/guess: As to why Johnny Depp has not pressed his clear case advantage against Amber is (...and I'm guessing here...) is that he is (unfortunately) still in love with her (???)

comment: There are a lot of things in this.  Her eyes move downward over and over, and that's a sign of something rehearsed being repeated.  She's accessing prepared responses.  If she had been looking upward she would have given cues she was accessing memories.  She tilts her head in an attempt to use "cuteness" and her attractiveness to sway her questioner.  She is also sitting with her hands under the table, hunched forward and head dropping in an attempt to appear small, weak, and defenseless, and also potentially under weight from the events.  She also keeps "fake chewing" which can be seen as not taking the questioner seriously.  She's also not very good at gas lighting, but she does try.  The eating appears to me as her trying to distract her self, and could be used as a calming activity for her to try to keep herself under control.  Also, eating during something like this might also purvey how unimpressed or not threatened she is by the situation.  Her body language is very dismissive of the questions and information requested of her.

comment:
I was with a 24 y old when I was 14 at 15 I even lived with him off and on until I was 17 we broke up when i was 4 m shy from turning 18. and we abused drugs during this time off and on and at the end of the night no matter the drug, day or vibe of the day at the end of the night he would change some say, ''oh its bc he couldn't handle his drugs'' but never the less the night would end with him flipping out over something stupid & meaningless and he would hit me or punch me saying something I did to deserve it.. later in the relationship this would happen even without the drugs any little thing would set him off and NO matter what it was bc of me how dare I make him so angry! it took me growing up and getting sick of being someone's punching bag and I believe now, my age added to this relationship at the time, coming from a broken family with a mother who had her own drug struggles. I was lost and needing love... but he was looking to control! I honestly don't like talking about this kinda shit bc it embarrasses me that I was so blinded by the idea of a ''loving boyfriend'' to the point that I dismissed the actual abusive boyfriend I had! Abuse is real in relationships and life-changing at that! You can just tell you want to hide it cover for them meanwhile loving the ''them'' u want that person to be..idk but coming from someone that has been abused and for many years the only one in this, I see as an abused party is johnny deep! and I'm so so happy for him to not only get away from amber but also finally started to see her as she really was instead of the (her) he wanted her to be! I'm so so happy the real story has come out for his sake! abuse isn't ok on either side! but to paint yourself as the abused party when in fact you were clearly the abuser lessens everyone out there really living through life with real abuse hanging on your back..  I mean my god even the way she speaks to him is abusive & not ok! I wish him nothing but happiness and real love.. he seems like a real dude a good big-hearted person and I wish him nothing but happiness truly!
4 what it's worth to whoever cares to read..=)

comment:
This video has proven even more so that there is absolutely no indication of her experiencimg physical abuse from Johnny Depp, it's incredibly difficult to take her statements remotely seriously, considering her presence during her questioning period was extremely ignorant and showed no interest. She was behaving incredibly immaturely for her age and isn't behaving like a domestic abuse victim at all!!! 
This woman shows absolutely zero signs of trauma when the domestic abuse is mentioned during the questioning andwhen audio is played back to her, none of her past emotions were triggered when revisiting that memory. No PTSD whatsoever! Absolute fraud!
Any abuse victim would be shaken up about a situation such as hers, especially after having to revisit audio about the said abuse, a real victim would have a totally different response to all of it and be very uncomfortable about the entire thing.
But she doesn't seem to be affected by any of it! And her body language/vocal range tells us, the viewers, a lot about the reality of each response she's given.
Her energy gives off a, "nobody can prove me wrong/I win" kinda vibe. 

This woman is dangerous and should face the consequences of her actions. Nobody deserves to be abused whether it be verbal, physical, emotional or all of the above....and to see her taking advantage of her gender(and how society views abuse towards women) is honestly disgraceful and unforgivable. 
What sucks is she'll probably end up with a slap on the wrist like doing community service hours as opposed to jail time, which is what she desperately deserves. She needs her platform removed from her ASAP, he voice must be taken away before she abuses another person!!!

comment:
The eye fluttering isn‚Äôt the biggest issue with the story of her sister though. It‚Äôs the contradictory statements that nail her here. She talks about her sister being at the top of the stairs, and him trying to push her down them, but he has to be below Whitney then, because Amber‚Äôs next statement is that she tries to get between them. If Whitney is at the top of the stairs, then Johnny would have to be below her for Amber to slide herself in between the two. But if Johnny‚Äôs below Whitney, then how could he try to push her down the stairs and not the other way around? 

This is exactly why I want Whitney to get subpoenaed. because logistically that‚Äôs not even possible. And I‚Äôm willing to bet that he either got between Whitney and Amber fighting, or she‚Äôs depicting a fight between her and Johnny where Whitney got between them. Her MO is always projection, so it likely happened but the roles were most likely reversed somehow.

comment:
This is why people like me don't believe these domestic abuse accusations any more, which is bad because ACTUAL victims of domestic abuse have harder times stepping forwards because of BITCHES, (yes, I said the B word) like this Amber Heard make them look like liars and frauds. 

Nowadays it is so easily to accuse someone for conducting domestic abuse (especially if the "victim" is a female and abuser is a male) and people will believe you because hey, they are a (victim and) WOMAN, without even thinking "Hey, do we have any strong evidence to support this like physical evidence of abuse or a psychological evaluation of both the victim and abuser?" It is so easy to win these lawsuit claims because a "He/she said it so it must be true." is considered evidence and nobody will bat an eye because we live in a victim society...

Not to mention the fact that the accused people have a much lower chance of winning IF they are successful and the "victim" is a random John/Jane Doe BECAUSE we like to project our insecurities about a lack of personal success AND or sympathies as a witch-hunt towards successful people ALL WITH AN EXCUSE "They are rich/successful so they will get away with it easy". These kinds of accusations ruin people's lives, hey, it's why Johnny was sacked from Pirates of the Caribbean. Not to mention the person who was accused will FOREVER have a dark cloud over their career, get less roles, nobody will wanna work with them WHILE the John/Jane Doe will just get a jail/cash sentence and that is it...

Who will the jury/judge/executioners believe, the woman or the cis white male rich guy?

comment: Hey, love your videos! The smiling you refer to is known as duping delight, it's a micro-expression that's often associated with lying. It's thought that the person smiles involuntarily due to a sense of gratification/pleasure that's derived from controlling the narrative and 'successfully' deceiving others. It's an unfortunate (or in this case fortunate) consequence of our nueroanatomy as our facial expressions are controlled by two distinct areas of the brain, one that controls voluntary action and the other involuntary action!

comment:
"It also misrepresents what actually happened which was him trying to get into the room"

*The tape*
Johnny: I opened the bathroom door when ¬∞you were knocking on it.
Amber: *Ye*
Johnny: After a few times I opened... And you know ‚Ä¢you just come in... ¬∂I tried to close the door 3 times...
Amber: *Ye*
Johnny: ‚àÜWhen I was trying to close the door, I guess it scraped your toes.
Amber: *Ye*
-Johnny: Then you opened the door and -_-accidentally-_- hit me in the head-
-Amber: Ye-

¬∞You don't knock on the door to get out of a room that you are hiding from your "abuser" in. Especially not said "abuser" is on the other side.
‚Ä¢"You tried to come in" Oh, so Amber wasn't already in?
¬∂"I tried to close the door 3 times" I thought Amber said that Johnny was trying to *_open_* the door?
‚àÜNote that since doors open *into* a room, and he *closed* the door on her feet: that means that she was standing outside of the room.
Edit: Also if the door *opened* to hit him them he must have been *inside* the room.

comment:
Okay, so... I grew up with an abusive parent, and one thing I noticed right off the bat is that a lot of the time, especially for the first questions is that she avoids eye contact while the question is being asked. But she makes full eye contact while answering.


THIS is something my abusive parent would do a lot. Not making eye contact when being asked a question (at least in my experience) usually means that they're either trying to think up an answer (or lie as it were), or they have already thought up and memorized a script of some sort in their head. This way they can try to twist the question around to their favor and turn it against either the person asking or the victim. It's basically another type of Projection.

I'm just going to present the facts you left out, either because you weren't aware of them or otherwise.


The incident they are discussing in this video is well documented; what happened was Johnny Depp was about to shove Amber Heard's sister down a flight of stairs. So she attacked in him in self-defense, to prevent this from happening. (All verified, look into it).


The fact she hit him, which is absolutely the ONLY thing this video confirms, does not inherently mean she is an abuser. Self-Defense is not abuse.
Here's what we also know:


Johnny Depp has repeatedly physically attacked Amber Heard in unprovoked acts that were not self defense. 
(objectively irrefutable video documentation of this exists).

I am all too familiar with Projection. Ever since I was old enough to be aware, my mom verbally abused my alcoholic father, who was a passive aggressive master projector. I mean, this is literally despicable, disgraceful, a shameful act of lying, and if anybody has any intelligence, would see through this entire facade that Amber was ever physically abused.  I hope she gets locked up, saving future gullible victims of this atrocious piece of garbage, and when she dies, burns in hell. there is no forgiveness for a liar.  There is nothing they can do to reconcile, they are narcissists, they are abusers, they are users, they are manipulators, they are fucking the scum of the earth.

they remind me so much of my parents. I remember one time, where they were fighting (verbally) and my mother started throwing plates  at my dad. So he tried to get away from her, but she followed him still throwing heavy stuff like books at him. so he grabed a pillow from the couch trying to protect his face and when my mother got closer, still hitting him with the book, he pushed the  pillow in her direction to keep her at distance. Afterwards she tried to convince me and my brother, that my father was the one beeing physically violent because the pillow actually made contact with her body while the plates and the books were mostly missing him. Which is exactly the same amber does in this clip where she tries to make something that was an act of self-defence look like the actual abuse. Also this whole calling someone a coward for trying to get out of a terrible situation scenario sounds very familiar to me. its exactly what my mother does. She is really good at making people feel like the last piece of shit in an argument. whenever she is abusing someone verbally and that someone tries to get away from her, she will follow them, calling them a coward or an ignorant douchbag whos not willing to listen to her. And in the end she will excuse her violent behavior with something like "I had no other choice than screaming at you/hitting you because otherwise you will not pay attantion to me which is soooo disrespectful of you".
To me its just creepy how similar abusive people behave. Im just glad Johnny Depp managed to get out at least.

Oh, please. She was badly prepped for this interview, she didn't memorize her script, and she's trying to wing it - BADLY. That's why she looks so uncomfortable, because trying to say what happened (per script) versus what actually happened is causing a cognitive dissonance in her mind. I'm always about believing the victim but I also know a manipulator when I see one. I never doubted Johnny Depp, and it's not because of his gender or because he's Depp...but when you know, you know. comment:
You might have missed a really clear lie. When she first told the story about the bathroom incident, she said she was attempting to escape a room and Johnny was trying to get in. She said she tried to "open the door to escape". Well, she didn't realize that Johnny would be telling the story describing which rooms they were in. So her story of trying to escape into a bathroom wouldn't make sense, so she changed it. 

Later on, after he mentioned being in the bathroom and trying to keep the door closed, she changed her story. She then said Johnny was trying to get IN the room and she was trying to get out, none of which makes sense. 

Your channel has the best coverage of this case. This is so maddening, but I'm glad to see you are making sure the truth is known.

comment: Yes, I can explain it to you; it's called narcissistic personality disorder. there's a big difference between someone being narcissistic and actually having the cluster be narcissistic personality disorder.I would call her what is referred to in the DSM as a malignant narcissist. A malignant narcissist is anyone who has NPD plus any other cluster b personality disorder. In her case I would guess NPD and sociopathy or psychopathy depending on whether she was born that way or she became that way that is the big difference between sociopath and psychopath one is born and the other is created. I know these things because I double majored in psychology and sociology and because I just spent the last ten years of my life with malignant narcissistic personality disordered man. almost everything she does and says is exactly like what he does and says to this day he denieseverything and does what she's doing by turning it around and saying I didn't do that you did that. This is a very sick and dangerous. She may be a little woman, skinny and cute, but Johnny being a real man and a gentle soul from everything I've seen would do anything possible not to retaliate including running away and hiding in the bathroom. I know this because I've had to do it. the problem with narcissistic personality disorder is it causes what is called narcissistic abuse syndrome also known as narcissistic victim syndrome in the person that they have been abusing. I'm just glad Johnny was able to get out faster than I was. Because it destroyed me physically emotionally and I am still in therapy trying to find my self again. I've always been a very strong woman... And he knew I was physically disabled when we got together but my physical health went downhill very fast over the last 10 years.I hope Johnny is able to find a specialist in narcissistic abuse syndrome because regular therapists in phds have no clue what they're dealing with and they often blame the victim because they don't understand the disorder of the narcissist what it does to the victim

comment:
It always breaks my heart how she said to Johnny that no one would believe he was abused. :( If you‚Äôre a man and you‚Äôre being abused, whether your partner is male or female, don‚Äôt be embarrassed or ashamed. The person hurting you should be the one feeling embarrassed and ashamed. Please, please, if you aren‚Äôt ready to tell the police then tell a good close friend who you trust and who has a good heart; Talking about it will make you feel better. If you don‚Äôt have a close friend or anyone you feel safe talking to, see if you can see a therapist (you can tell the abuser it is a different kind of doctor appt. & be sure to schedule it while they are at work). Hopefully, once you‚Äôve spoken about it, then you can find a way to get out of the situation and hopefully to have the person held responsible for their actions. 
Just please don‚Äôt keep it inside.
There ARE people, both male and female, who WILL believe you, and you don‚Äôt deserve to be treated that way. Whether you‚Äôre 5‚Äô4‚Äù and 165lbs or 6‚Äô3‚Äù and 250lbs. no one has the right to touch you in any way you don‚Äôt want, especially if it causes you any pain, or fear.

This entire case made me so angry. Firstly Johnny Depp has never been violent towards amy woman hes been with. He loved her in spite of her terrible treatment which is a classic sign of a partner who is involved with a narcissist. Amber has fame and she is able to act so its easier for her to feel like she has the power or the upperhand as well has her using her gender to play the victim role.

She is a sociopath with slightly more control than your average joe because of her trade and even her answers are still blame shifting. Theres a reason to why she hit him or smashed a door in his face, or severing part of his finger.

Two entitled, narcissistic, rich girls who projected their own faults onto me in retaliation against me; because I had the nerve to eventually stand up to them and tell them that they were full of shit.  I am now over two years removed from my last dealings with those people, and I am still picking up the pieces of my life.  I am much better off now, and I am grateful to have escaped from their presence in my life.  But I am still in shock over the fact that I was gaslighted ferociously by two seemingly upstanding "professionals."  Just goes to show that therapists can be nuts too.

comment:
I think she's a total bitch, and a liar. I never trusted her. So I hate to say anything that goes any way in her favour, however, my ex would use exaggerated terms to describe events in order to turn the tables on me. I'm referring to Amber's comment about Depp's use of "clocked" as dramatic. 

I distinctly remember a time in which my ex and I were in a disagreement- and i had been working on myself for a yr learning how to disagree civilly, because getting excited,emotional or loud only exacerbates a heated situation. So i spoke calmly sans sarcasm, no matter how upset i got, I responded in a way similar to that in a couples therapy session. It f'n sucked sometimes; he'd be turning the mean-snark all the way up to 10, and I had to hold my emotions in and not react üò£üò§. Anyway, in that 1 argument he kept telling me to stop yelling at him. I just rolled my eyes over the phone. The next day he explained that he got angry because "you can yell without yelling....." Yeah, he said that about me. I was _"yelling without yelling."_ üôÑ

He would accuse me of slamming doors when i specifically tried to carefully shut them when i knew he was trying to sleep (he was hungover a lot). He often used words like "always, never, the worst..." to make me seem bad. But that's when I found out that he was a manipulator. His mother even talked to me about how she thought he did it on purpose (he did it to his family too) because he wanted to keep drinking (he is an alcoholic) and the disagreements usually stemmed from that. 

So yeah. Ppl can use descriptive terms deceptively, though I don't feel that's what happened with Heard.
author: A side of Aioli

comment:
What does all this mean? Her smiling when remembering hitting Depp? I think it's obvious, if you've experienced a covert narcissist. She's getting a thrill, but doesn't seem to realize it's showing on her face. Trying to cover her abuse towards Depp, Heard is not pretending very well at this moment, which is why her lawyer keeps antagonizing the other. They're very good at manipulation, however, their body language gives their agenda away some times.


I remember going to court when my ex-girlfriend/ex-abuser filed a petition against me claiming all sorts of sordid fabrications. She's really good at pretending...most of the time. In this instance, however, she gave away her agenda through behavior. Instead of acting as though she was in fear, or slinking away trying to pretend actual shame in the idea she'd been abused, she was giddy, smiling, and very jovial. Not the description of a person having lived through such a traumatic situation, but one who hadn't a care in the world. And she didn't because she was seeing me in agony. All of her fabrications basically went down the drain because her pretense was betrayed by her ineptitude at keeping up the charade. Why? Because she was having too much fun, and probably convinced herself she was doing well acting out the abused victim role. Maybe she knew she wasn't going to be sought after, indeed, she knew I wasn't going to try to battle around a protective order. 


They attempt to seem genuine, but sometimes their attempts fail, and they aren't always called out on it.
author: Lance Lust

I pointed this video out to a couple people, and they still didn't believe me. They finally believed me when Johnny came out with the defamation lawsuit. ü§£ü§£ü§£

I'm sorry, but just because you have tits and a vagina, that doesn't automatically make you innocent. I'm so sick of the "guilty until proven innocent" bullshit. I don't know why society has seemed to have adopted that mentality. Yes, more women should speak out about their experiences, but people like Amber use this to their advantage, because they know they'll get away with it, and that's bullshit.

I can't wait to see Johnny get the justice he finally deserves. I can't believe he had to endure her abuse.

comment:
When my EX-wife accused me of domestic violence against her and my children (which THEY denied), one of the things that she had to admit was an attempt to smash my computer. The JUDGE construed this as "an act of self defence ." How?


If these tapes hadn't come to light, Ms. Heard would still be the 'champion of victims of domestic violence' and Johnny would still be the violent, evil social pariah that Hollywood were eager to make him, based on her word alone.
Fortunately, Mr children were old enough to know their father, so, even though I  lost my home, my jod and many of my 'friends', I still have a great relationship with my kids


The courts themselves are very much against us. Amber could still walk away from this Scott free as long as Judges continue to have this attitude.
The protection of women in these instances are part of the problem. 
And when a woman's story constantly changes, as with Amber Heard and my ex-wife, maybe they SHOULD NOT be believed.


BTW, I had people who were prepared to testify against my ex, including the school Principal and her best friend, but, despite my insistence, my lawyer (a woman) never 'got around' to taking their depositions, nor were they ever called into court.



Spare a thought, please, for all the men out there who are, or have been in the same situation as Johnny, but who do not have the tapes to clear their names.
Something needs to change.

author: Julie Boswell

comment:
She is an actress. She knows how to put on a convincing argument. "Make it so that you believe it, you become that person, sell it." In parts, she sounds like she's been rehearsing this by mimicking Johnny's stammer: "I, I, I..." 

And the snacks. She's like "Ooo. I like this excuse to eat junk food. Ooo. Chocolate."

She's not worried at all that some people might not believe her. Everyone who sides with her is a victory. It's like she's collecting someone else's money out of a burning house, knowing she gets to keep whatever she can salvage. 

Johnny, however, doesn't want ONE PERSON to think he'd done something like that. To him, every person who believes Amber is a loss on his reputation. People with high values and morals don't like it when someone claims their pristine record isn't based on reality. You've lived your life honestly, and then someone comes in and starts making up stories, anyone would be upset about it.


Even Amber hates it when Johnny claims something that isn't true, namely that she pushed the door on purpose (quite possibly a genuine accident, but doesn't change the "you scraped my toes by accident, the appropriate punishment is a punch in the face" but "ME pushing a door into you by accident is OK! I didn't mean it!" Another thing, by her own account she's not a gold digger. The way she interprets it. She doesn't want anyone to think she'd be a gold digger. She admits to everything SHE thinks is OK, which is telling a lot. "Yes, I meant to hit you", but she thinks it's fine. She had a just cause. "You hurt my toes" or "you're trying to escape. It's understandable I'd try to hit you!"

Off the courts, Amber boasts about "the kind of bling a girl needs" showing off knuckle irons, while Johnny is being his mild-mannered self. To Amber, the REAL embarrassment would be that people think she's soft. She's not. She didn't take ballet lessons, she shot guns, right? She's a tough cookie, right, but she just doesn't want to get into trouble for it. She is like the high school bully girl who thinks the judge is the principle and anyone squealing is a snitch, that will be punished after school behind the gym. Then she's genuinely offended and outraged that the guy isn't the gentleman who takes the blame for their troubles.


She's also not at all uncomfortable being dubbed "the Danish Girl star", as if she played the female lead. Are you all aware she was just a 2-line extra in the movie? (Okay, to be fair, maybe 3. You can't blame me for forgetting which role she played, let alone how many lines she had!)

comment:
Why did they not mention that what she was saying while being interviewed did not match what they were saying in the conversation between JD and AH?? He literally says he was trying to close the door, in the process of attempting to close the door he scraped her toes, which she admits, and that that was when he bent over and got hurt by her. 

Also how is that even supposed to work? She says she was trying to close the door in attempt to get away from him, he clearly got hit in the head by the door, they both admit that much, a door has to go outwards towards JD for him to get hit in the head by the door, that means her toes can't get scraped if the door is going outwards, and she's supposedly according to her story attempting to close the door which has to be inwards, you wouldn't put your foot in a spot where you know the door is supposed to close while you're trying to pull it closed, would you? However if you're forcing your way into a room with a door that goes outwards for you and somebody on the opposite side is trying to close it it is possible that your toes get scraped and that you hit the other person in the head with the door, which by the sound of it is exactly what she did. Is she fucking dense with this explanation of hers? And where is the logic of the legal representatives??

Why the heck is it a problem/harrassment/not allowed to ask about things she has said herself as well? Don't you need to fact check things as a legal representative? And how are the facts not relevant to the domestic abuse case?

comment:
Once again, thank you for your clear delivery of the truth. I think that things are getting uncomfortable in Amber Heard's fantasyland. When the "Conspirators" began this charade, they were thinking about all the money that they would get when Mr. Depp backed down. Now, each and every one of them must be calculating how much time they will serve for each time they broke the law in their attempt to frame Mr. Depp.
      Josh Drew must have provided some clarity to the situation when he was deposed in November, 2019. His marriage to conspirator Raquel Pennington ended in divorce, and I don't believe he is willing to go to Jail for Ms. Heard.
      The only viable story Ms. Heard can use now is to say she was so completely devastated by the divorce (that SHE filed for) that iO Tillett Wright and Raquel Pennington manipulated her through the whole scenario. iO Tillett Wright was living on Mr. Depp's estate, and using his private jet, for free, UNTIL Mr. Depp discovered iO was in love with his wife, and they were having an affair, which led to iO Tillet Wright being asked to leave. iO had also "outed" Mr. Depp's daughter, who was a minor at the time. Raquel Pennington, Amber Heard's best friend, lived, free of charge, in one of Mr. Depp's Penthouse Apartments (along with her fiancee, Josh Drew). Raquel Pennington also used a second Penthouse Apartment to run her "bead business" from. Ms. Heard also paid her five figures to "walk the dogs (two teacup yorkies).
      Both of these parties had every reason to want Ms. Heard's marriage over, and Ms. Heard to have all the money. California does have a No Fault Divorce system...but one of the few ways that you can get more money than you are legally entitled to would be to prove domestic abuse. I don't think Ms. Heard is clever enough to make this story believable. She certainly isn't a good enough actress to convince anyone. But now that her options are limited, and some conspirators are breaking ranks to make their own deals, I wouldn't be surprised if she attempted to weave a narrative like this, putting primary blame on the others. If only because we have had to watch an innocent man suffer for four years, I will enjoy watching Amber Heard's ship sink beneath her.
author: NIBS

comment:
I'm no expert but people who eat during questioning or during a depo is a bit of a giveaway. It's an attempt to distract people from seeing the lie. Also, the elaborate hand gestures can be seen as a way for a person to distract. The unnecessary actions are also a way to relieve adrenaline that pumps through a person when they lie.
Also, it's not true that if a person looks at you directly in the eye while giving a statement, they're telling the truth. Most of the time, to remember the past events, one does it slowly and pauses. Eyes would look up to either left or right because the brain is trying to remember the events. Well, when she was saying that she's protecting her sister and the stairs, blah-blah-blah--- that's just too much acting..

comment: About a couple of years back I contacted the police because a horrific memory I'd supressed came up in therapy about my domestic abuser. Even with only two of them in the room I was shaking, I could barely drink let alone eat, it was extremely painful for me to meet their eyes because it was so terrifying for me talking about events that happened nearly 10 years ago. I have no trouble recalling what happened to me because I had re-lived it multiple times a day for months after it came back again in therapy. The only time I laughed it was out of nervousness and I probably seemed a bit mad. If you'd compared our two interviews it would have been like chalk and cheese. I know not everyone is the same, but for her to say that this is something that deeply affected her and then spend the entire interview rolling her eyes and calmly smiling over something that was supposed to be her life being threatened, it doesn't add up to me.

comment: God I know people like her too well. Me and my family adopted a girl I grew up with she had a horrible mother who always had little to no food in the house and was just very neglectful.  About two years ago we went over to one of my moms high school friends she had just reconnected with for new years (she had been to our house multiple times) my mother and father had recently got divorced he was an alcoholic my mother wasn't but she still didn't drink as she didn't want to tempt him. She was drunk (all of us were old enough for no supervision to be needed or for it to be inappropriate) she went in the bathroom and was just yelling about nothing really . We were just going to let my mom be she wasn't hurting anyone and my mothers friend 19 or so year old son was in there making sure she was alright  . She went in there for about five or six minutes  and came out crying saying my mom was just like her mom. She claimed my mother threw her into the bathtub and when my mother did so her back hit the towel rack. Well she had no bruises there was no noise other then speaking in the bathroom. . She told my mothers friend in hopes she could stay there  I guess she liked how she treated her kids better I'm still not sure why after we did so much bought her everything she asked for even though we weren't well off but well enough to get along but moving on . comment:
I'd like to know how Amber was allowed snacks. In a stressful situation where a person is petrified the truth will be exposed; and there happens to be food or a drink within arms reach. They'll immediately start snacking or sipping. It's a defense mechanism for several reasons, but the number 1 reason is you're no longer only reading the facial expressions of the situation. 
Think of it like someone is questioning you, and you feel they can read the truth on your face. Your eyes become wider, you may get shakey, and without a distraction, you're gonna stay like that and eventually choke on your words and/or break. Grabbing a bite of food momentarily pulls you out of that state, allowing you to collect yourself and continue lying. If there was any truth behind her words, she wouldn't have needed those snanks.
author: A Vx

comment: Hang on...so at 6:02 AH says she was trying to escape from a room where she alleges JD was attacking her. Maybe doors work differently in America, but if you are escaping a room and trying to close a door between you and an attacker, you will be pulling the door towards you because where I live, doors generally open inwards into rooms and therefore need to be pulled towards you to close them as you leave. But for the sake of argument, lets say the door she was 'exiting' through worked the other way and she was trying to force it closed to keep him out when the corner of it hit him in the head.  How is that even possible? The corner/edge of the door is on her side and it would be physically impossible for it to hit him as he'd have been faced with the flat side of the door. So straight away, it's clear that what she said cannot be true. If JD was hit by the corner/edge of the door, he was behind the door which was forcefully pushed open from the other side...so he must have been trying to keep the door closed between them and she was trying to force it open.

comment:
I've been following Nerdette's NewsStand on this story as well, and in one of her videos she mentions something very interesting. Amber apparently was on drugs that if taken in excess, can cause rage and delusion. I think that, when it comes to the extreme cases of violence at least, Amber blames the drugs and not herself, which is why she feels comfortable to lie about it. She doesn't feel responsible for her actions. It could be that, between the drugs and the rage, some of it is a blur like she says. But instead of owning up to it, she chose to double down, project and lie. As a narcissist would.
Don't get me wrong, even if this is true, I still think she's a horrible and manipulative person. But I want to really understand and not just chalk everything up to 'she's a horrible human being that feels no reservation to lie, abuse and physically attack others'. I think that her normally cold and calculating personality collided with the violent and raging outbursts from the drugs, and that's why it often sounds like we're hearing about two different people altogether. the manipulator from behind the scenes, and the violent abuser

comment: Sooooo, when watching the clips of this narcissistic personality type as she definitely is... I would love my own hand to either forehand or back hand that smug face of hers. Unfortunately I have had the misfortune or fortune if I look at it in a positive light üí° to learn about narcs and disorders because of one very twisted person I met. A narc will project, twist distort, gaslight by all means to save face. They think they are being manipulative, believable, making you feel off balance through all their twisted lies that somehow you made them do it.  Oh and the arrogance. You think you can fix them, overlook their crap for the sake of trying to help them see truth etc.. Does not work!
